p: It is uncertain that the epidemics in Batavia (Jakarta), Indonesia, and Cairo, Egypt, in 1779 were dengue. Serologic studies have identified DENV-1 as the predominant virus in the Philippines and Greece in the 1920s and in the South Pacific in the 1930s ( Halstead and Papaevangelou, 1980, Simmons, 1931, Rosen, 1986). It was this serotype that also caused the major regional epidemic that occurred in the Pacific and Asia during the Second World War ( Hotta, 1953, Kuno, 2009, Sabin and Schlesinger, 1945).
